ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Staff code number of person completing this form
Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: relashionship of respondent to individual
Today, would you say that All, Some, or None the medicines in your home are stored unlocked?
Notes: 0 = No medicines at home; 1 = All are stored unlocked; 2 = Some are stored unlocked; 3 = None are stored unlocked; 8 = Don't Know

ElementDescription: You said some medicines in your home are stored unlocked. I'm going to read some types of medications. For each type, please tell me whether None, Some, or All are stored unlocked. - Prescription pain medications

You said some medicines in your home are stored unlocked. I'm going to read some types of medications. For each type, please tell me whether None, Some, or All are stored unlocked. - Other prescription medications

You said some medicines in your home are stored unlocked. I'm going to read some types of medications. For each type, please tell me whether None, Some, or All are stored unlocked. - Over-the-counter pain medications

You said some medicines in your home are stored unlocked. I'm going to read some types of medications. For each type, please tell me whether None, Some, or All are stored unlocked. - Other over-the-counter medications
If at least some medications are locked, could you access any of the locked medications?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes, easily; 2 = Yes, but it might be difficult; 8 = Don't Know

ElementDescription: Today, how many firearms do you have in your home - one or more than one?
Notes: 1 = One; 2 = More than one; 3 = None; 8 = Don't Know

ElementDescription: If your home has only one gun, is this gun stored unlocked?
If your home has only one gun, is this gun stored loaded?
If your home has more than one gun, how many of these guns are stored unlocked?
Notes: 0 = None; 1 = One; 2 = More than one; 8= Don't Know

ElementDescription: If your home has more than one gun, how many of the guns you have at home are stored loaded?
Notes: 0 = None; 1 = One; 2 = More than one; 8 = Don't Know

ElementDescription: If your home has an unknown number of guns, to the best of your knowledge, is there at least one gun in your home stored unlocked?
If your home has an unknown number of guns, to the best of your knowledge, is there at least one gun in your home stored loaded?
For any guns that are locked, can you please describe which devices are used? (Check all that apply)
Notes: 1 = Gun safe; 2 = Locked closet or cabinet; 3 = Locked room; 4 = Locking device like cable lock or trigger lock; 5 = Intrinsic lock; 8 = Don't Know

ElementDescription: For any guns that are locked, could you personally unlock at least one?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes, easily; 2 = Yes, but it might be difficult; 8 = Don't Know

ElementDescription: Do you have any guns stored away from your home?
If you have guns stored away from your home, where are they currently stored?
Notes: 1 = At a relative's home; 2 = At a friend's home; 3 = At a gun range or sports club; 4 = At a gun store; 5 = With the police/law enforcement; 6 = At a pawn shop; 7 = Other; 9 = Refused; 8 = Don't know

ElementDescription: If you have guns stored away from your home, where are they currently stored? Other: specify
Do you personally own the guns we've been talking about?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes, at least one but not all; 2 = Yes, all of them; 9 = Refused; 8 = Don't know

ElementDescription: Who makes decisions about how guns in your home are stored?
Notes: 1 = I do, by myself; 2 = I do, with someone else in the home; 3 = Someone else in the home does; 9 = Refused; 8 = Don't know/not sure

ElementDescription: If someone else makes or helps to make decisions about how guns in your home are stored, who is that person? (Choose all that apply)
Notes: 1 = My spouse/partner/significant other; 2 = Brother/brother-in-law; 3 = Sister/sister-in-law; 4 = Parent/parent-in-law; 5 = Adult child (at least 18 years old); 6 = Child; 7 = Other adult (including roommates or friends); 9 = Refused; 8 = Don't know

ElementDescription: If someone else makes or helps to make decisions about how guns in your home are stored, is/was that person in the ER with you today?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 9 = Refused; 8 = Don't know/not sure

ElementDescription: Do you remember any ER provider talking with you today how you store medications in your home?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 9 = Refused; 8 = Don't know/not sure

ElementDescription: Do you remember any ER provider talking with you today whether you have access to guns at home?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 9 = Refused; 8 = Don't know/not sure

ElementDescription: How much do you agree with the following statements: Having access to a gun in the home increases the likelihood of death by suicide when someone is at risk
Notes: 1 = Strongly agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Disagree; 5 = Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: How much do you agree with the following statements: Locking up firearms or storing them away from the home reduces the likelihood of death by suicide when someone is at risk
Notes: 1 = Strongly agree; 2 = Agree; 3 = Neither agree nor disagree; 4 = Disagree; 5 = Strongly disagree

ElementDescription: For every 10 people who survive a suicide attempt, how many do you think will later die by suicide?
For every 10 people who attempt suicide using a gun, how many (on average) do you think will die?

Considering the firearm storage option(s) you prefer: Do you know the risks or drawbacks of each option?

Considering the firearm storage option(s) you prefer: Are you clear about which risks and drawbacks matter to me?
Considering the firearm storage option(s) you prefer: Do you have enough support from others to make a choice?
Considering the firearm storage option(s) you prefer: Are you choosing without pressure from others?

Considering the firearm storage option(s) you prefer: Are you clear about the best choice for you?

Considering the firearm storage option(s) you prefer: Is this decision easy for you to make?
Considering the firearm storage option(s) you prefer: Do you feel you have made an informed choice?
Considering the firearm storage option(s) you prefer: Does your decision who what is important to you?
Considering the firearm storage option(s) you prefer: Do you expect to stick with your decision?
Considering the firearm storage option(s) you prefer: Are you satisfied with your decision?
I feel confident that I can: Get the facts about the firearm storage choices available to me
Notes: 1 = Not at all confident; 5 = Very confident

ElementDescription: I feel confident that I can: Get the facts about the benefits of each choice
Notes: 1 = Not at all confident; 5 = Very confident

ElementDescription: I feel confident that I can: Get the facts about the risks and downsides of each choice
Notes: 1 = Not at all confident; 5 = Very confident

ElementDescription: I feel confident that I can: Understand the information enough to be able to make a choice
Notes: 1 = Not at all confident; 5 = Very confident

ElementDescription: I feel confident that I can: Ask questions without feeling dumb
Notes: 1 = Not at all confident; 5 = Very confident

ElementDescription: I feel confident that I can: Express my concerns about each choice
Notes: 1 = Not at all confident; 5 = Very confident

ElementDescription: I feel confident that I can: Ask for advice
Notes: 1 = Not at all confident; 5 = Very confident

ElementDescription: I feel confident that I can: Figure out the choice that best suits me
Notes: 1 = Not at all confident; 5 = Very confident

ElementDescription: I feel confident that I can: Handle unwanted pressure from others in making my choice
Notes: 1 = Not at all confident; 5 = Very confident

ElementDescription: After today's visit, how likely is it that you will change the way you store these things at home? - Medications
Notes: 1 = Extremely likely; 7 = Extremely unlikely; -888 = I don't have any potentially toxic medications

ElementDescription: After today's visit, how likely is it that you will change the way you store these things at home? - Firearms
If the likelihood of changing firearm storage habits was 1 - 5 (moderately to extremely likely), what changes do you think you will make? Choose all that apply
Notes: 0 = I will use a/more locking devices (such as trigger locks) in my home; 1 = I will use a/more locking safes or gun lockboxes in my home; 2 = I will give a/more guns to a trusted family member for safekeeping; 3 = I will give a/more guns to a trusted friend for safekeeping; 4 = I will store a/more guns at a store or range that has firearm storage; 5 = I will give a /more guns to a law enforcement agency that has firearm storage; 7 = Other; NA - not applicable

ElementDescription: If the likelihood of changing firearm storage habits was 1 - 5 (moderately to extremely likely), what changes do you think you will make? Choose all that apply - Other: specify
If the likelihood of changing firearm storage habits was 6 or 7 (change extremely unlikely), why is it unlikely that you will make changes?
The length of the web tool was
Notes: 1 = Too long; 2 = Just right; 3 = Too short; 98 = Refused; 97 = Don't know

ElementDescription: The amount of information was
Notes: 1 = Too much information; 2 = Just right; 3 = Too little information; 9 = Refused; 8 = Don't know

ElementDescription: I found the web tool
Notes: 1 = Slanted towards option in the home (locked up and inaccessible to the person at risk); 2 = Slanted towards option outside the home (like storage elsewhere); 3 = Balanced; 9 = Refused; 8 = Don't know

ElementDescription: Did you find this web tool useful in helping you make a decision about changing firearm access?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 9 = Refused; 8 = Don't know/not sure

ElementDescription: If you did not find the web tool useful in helping you make a decision about changing firearm access, then why?
Do you think the web tool included enough information to help a person decide on ways to change home access to firearms?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 9 = Refused; 8 = Don't know/not sure

ElementDescription: If you do not think the web tool included enough information to help a person decide on ways to change home access to firearms, then why?

ElementDescription: If the web tool did not explain legal issues related to how guns are stored, then why?

ElementDescription: If the options presented did not feel realistic for your family, then why?
Would you recommend this tool to a friend or family member in a similar situation?

ElementDescription: If you would not recommend this tool to a friend or family member in a similar situation, then why?
Would you want the option to email web tool responses to yourself (rather than printing)?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 9 = Refused; 8 = Don't know/not sure

ElementDescription: Where, if anywhere, do you think this web tool could be useful?
Notes: 1 = Outpatient mental health clinics/settings; 2 = Emergency departments; 3 = On suicide prevention websites; 4 = On firearm websites (like the NRA or other gun education, retail, or advocacy groups); 4 = On other public websites; 5 = In settings for veterans/at the VA; 6 = In the military; 7 = None of the above; 9 = Refused; 8 = Don't know
